introduction:
You will be given a task consisting of two parts:
1. A word-learning phase where you will be shown examples of a new word and give a similarity score of the word.
2. A similarity judgement phase where you will be asked to rate the similarity of pairs of objects for a total of 435 objects.
word_learning:
Mr. Frog speaks a different language, and you are helping him to pick out the object he wants. You'll be given a novel word and some examples of the word.

Here is a bub:
1. Dalmatian

Now pick out the other bubs from the following list:
1. pig
2. tractor
3. box truck
4. Dalmatian
5. seal
6. cat
7. crane
8. loader
9. terrier
10. eggplant
11. eggplant
12. semi-trailer truck
13. green bell pepper
14. potato
15. red bell pepper
16. box truck
17. bear
18. garbage truck
19. mutt
20. onion
21. car
22. motorcycle
23. red bell pepper
24. Dalmatian
25. yellow bell pepper
26. basset hound
27. Labrador
28. full-trailer truck
29. green bell pepper
30. chiller truck
31. pumpkin
32. carrot
33. school bus
34. bee
35. toucan
36. yellow bell pepper
word_learning_format:
The output should be formatted as a JSON instance that conforms to the JSON schema below.

As an example, for the schema {"properties": {"foo": {"title": "Foo", "description": "a list of strings", "type": "array", "items": {"type": "string"}}}, "required": ["foo"]}
the object {"foo": ["bar", "baz"]} is a well-formatted instance of the schema. The object {"properties": {"foo": ["bar", "baz"]}} is not well-formatted.

Here is the output schema:
```
{"properties": {"objects_chosen": {"description": "objects that the word applied to", "items": {}, "title": "Objects Chosen", "type": "array"}, "choice_explanation": {"description": "explanation of objects chosen", "title": "Choice Explanation", "type": "string"}, "required": ["objects_chosen", "choice_explanation"]}
```
similarity_judgement:
Next, for each pair of the objects below, rate the similarity of the two objects on a scale of 1 (not similar at all) to 9 (extremely similar). Try your best to base your ratings on the same aspects of the objects that were important to you in making your choices during the word-learning phase:

2. bear and pumpkin
3. carrot and pumpkin

similarity_judgement_format:
The output should be formatted as a JSON instance that conforms to the JSON schema below.

As an example, for the schema {"properties": {"foo": {"title": "Foo", "description": "a list of strings", "type": "array", "items": {"type": "string"}}}, "required": ["foo"]}
the object {"foo": ["bar", "baz"]} is a well-formatted instance of the schema. The object {"properties": {"foo": ["bar", "baz"]}} is not well-formatted.

Here is the output schema:
```
{"properties": {"similarity_score": {"description": "similarity score for each pair of objects", "items": {}, "title": "Similarity Score", "type": "array"}}, "required": ["similarity_score"]}
```
